jalse.entities

Interface EntityContainer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Entity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultEntity, JALSE

    public interface EntityContainer
    This is an Entity collection. Entities can only be added to a container by creating them and remove them by killing them. Entity creation and death can be listened for using EntityListener and EntityEvent.
    Author:
    Elliot Ford
    See Also:
    EntitySet, EntityFactory, Entities.emptyEntityContainer(), Entities.unmodifiableEntityContainer(EntityContainer)

      • addEntityListener

        boolean addEntityListener(EntityListener listener)
        Adds a listener for entities.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to add.
        Returns:
        true if container did not already contain this listener.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
        See Also:
        ListenerSet.add(Object)

      • getEntities

        java.util.Set<Entity> getEntities()
        Gets all the entities within the containers.
        Returns:
        Gets all entities or an empty set if none were found.

      • getEntity

        Entity getEntity(java.util.UUID id)
        Gets the entity with the specified ID.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The entity matching the supplied id or null if none found.

      • getEntityAsType

        default <T extends Entity> T getEntityAsType(java.util.UUID id,
                                             java.lang.Class<T> type)
        This is a convenience method for getting an entity (no optional). The entity is wrapped with the supplied entity type.
        Parameters:
        id - Unique ID of the entity.
        type - Entity type to wrap to.
        Returns:
        The entity matching the supplied id or null if none found.
        See Also:
        Entities.asType(Entity, Class)

      • getOptEntity

        default java.util.Optional<Entity> getOptEntity(java.util.UUID id)
        This is a convenience method for getting an entity (optional).
        Parameters:
        id - Unique ID of the entity.
        Returns:
        Gets an Optional of the resulting entity or an empty Optional if it was not found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the ID is null.

      • newEntity

        Entity newEntity()
        Creates a new entity with a random ID.
        Returns:
        The newly created entity's ID.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the entity limit has been reached.
        See Also:
        UUID.randomUUID(), JALSEExceptions.ENTITY_LIMIT_REACHED

      • newEntity

        <T extends Entity> T newEntity(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates a new entity with a random ID. This entity is marked as the specified entity type and then wrapped to it.
        Parameters:
        type - Entity type.
        Returns:
        The newly created entity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the entity limit has been reached.
        See Also:
        UUID.randomUUID(), JALSEExceptions.ENTITY_LIMIT_REACHED, Entity.markAsType(Class), Entities.asType(Entity, Class)

      • newEntity

        Entity newEntity(java.util.UUID id)
        Creates new entity with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - Entity ID.
        Returns:
        The newly created entity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the entity limit has been reached.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the entity ID is already assigned.
        See Also:
        JALSEExceptions.ENTITY_LIMIT_REACHED, JALSEExceptions.ENTITY_ALREADY_ASSOCIATED

      • newEntity

        <T extends Entity> T newEntity(java.util.UUID id,
                               java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates new entity with the specified ID. This entity is marked as the specified entity type and then wrapped to it.
        Parameters:
        id - Entity ID.
        type - Entity type.
        Returns:
        The newly created entity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the entity limit has been reached.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the entity ID is already assigned.
        See Also:
        JALSEExceptions.ENTITY_LIMIT_REACHED, JALSEExceptions.ENTITY_ALREADY_ASSOCIATED, Entity.markAsType(Class), Entities.asType(Entity, Class)

      • receiveEntity

        boolean receiveEntity(Entity e)
        Receives an entity (from a transfer). This method may receive an entity from within or outside the tree.
        Parameters:
        e - Entity to receive.
        Returns:
        Whether the entity was received.
        See Also:
        transferEntity(UUID, EntityContainer)

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if listener is null.
        See Also:
